subject: p19894745
History: -year-old with breast cancer and cirrhosis and increasing oxygen requirement and altered mental status, evaluate for infection or volume overload. Comparison is made to the patients prior study of at 21:15. Portable AP upright chest film, at 8:40 is submitted.
Impression: Apparent increase in layering right effusion. There are multiple bilateral nodular opacities which likely reflect metastatic disease in this patient with a recent diagnosis of breast cancer. Overall, cardiac and mediastinal contours are unchanged. No evidence of pulmonary edema. No definite evolving airspace disease to suggest pneumonia is visualized. Probable layering right effusion. No pneumothorax.
